name: A. Optimal Currency Exchange
statement:
Andrew was very excited to participate in Olympiad of Metropolises. Days
flew by quickly, and Andrew is already at the airport, ready to go home.
He has n rubles left, and would like to exchange them to euro and dollar
bills. Andrew can mix dollar bills and euro bills in whatever way he
wants. The price of one dollar is d rubles, and one euro costs e
rubles.Recall that there exist the following dollar bills: 1, 2, 5, 10,
20, 50, 100, and the following euro bills 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200 (note
that, in this problem we do consider the 500 euro bill, it is hard to
find such bills in the currency exchange points). Andrew can buy any
combination of bills, and his goal is to minimize the total number of
rubles he will have after the exchange.Help him write a program that
given integers n, e and d, finds the minimum number of rubles Andrew can
get after buying dollar and euro bills.
